Somehow I'm not surprised that people just don't care - And I don't mean this to say that you are wrong, because you are not. People just want to play a game together and with Bedrock's overall better performance and some features exclusive to it, excluding all of the obvious redstone functionality differences, they just don't care what's going on. It's sad, it's disappointing, but what can you really do? Besides, if they were to get rid of Bedrock, Microsoft would get like 50% less money in a single day - And again, don't mean to say that it's a bad thing. What I'm trying to say is that Microsoft would get run all over by people addicted to Bedrock Edition.

this sounds like an amazing idea! I imagine such a mechanic would have a lot of Redstone applications. think about having different goat horns being able to activate different pieces of Redstone around a base. you could basically have Redstone remotes in your inventory.

I don't think the copper horns should, just because its nice for the two forms to have their own unique niches. As for the redstone thing, I think it would be cool if the different horn sounds had different distances they could send to but because they would likely actuvate any sensors up to their distance limit it'd work more like a wireless comparator instead of a remote per se.

Agreed! It makes no sense why goat horns can be heard from so far away, but it only triggers skulk sensors and the Warden from a short range. Not to bring in YouTube, but I've been watching the latest season of Double Life, and the players are blowing horns like crazy down in the deep dark and it's doing practically nothing! From a consistency point of view, it makes sense for all sounds to only reach a certain distance but MAN do I wish goat horns were the exception.

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: ‚ÄúHumans‚Äù

Text: ‚ÄúI think it would be a good idea if humans are implemented in minecraft. Example: when you kill the dragon and the wither, it would be nice for the mobs (zombies, skeletons, and endermans) to become human, but not like the villagers, rather that they could build things invent things and talk to you, also that they can help defeat hostile mobs like creepers, wither skeletons, etc. Also that they have the ability to do things, like mine, farm, build, have children, build and create things like airplanes, trains, etc. That they can get sick, and be cured, that they have jobs like police, or doctors and nurses, things like that. I think this would improve minecraft and make it more fun and more purchased and installed game. I would love for this idea to be implemented, at least little by little, but it will be implemented. Thanks‚Äù

- Translated by Admin

We truly need this type of upgrade because it gets tiring repairing your tools one by one while with Off-hand you can repair them both tools at once and maybe more.

It certainly is an upset being left out as bedrock players, but I think it may be because they want to work on it before officially changing anything permnantly.
